messages.subject: Re: good samurai books
messages.msgSnippet: The Sengoku bibliography has a number of excellent books about Japanese history. You can view it at http://www.sengoku.com/bibl.html Just FYI. Mark Arsenault
messages.messageBody:
The Sengoku bibliography has a number of excellent books about Japanese
history. You can view it at http://www.sengoku.com/bibl.html

Just FYI.


Mark Arsenault
Sengoku List Taisho
----------------------------------------------
http://www.sengoku.com - The official site of the Sengoku RPG!

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] good samurai books
messages.msgSnippet: ... I would check out Musui s Story, even if it might be shocking for the ones who like the idealized imagine of the brave, loyal, mighty samurai. cepo
messages.messageBody:
On Jan 14, 2004, at 3:53 PM, jacob gerhard wrote:

> I also recomend the book "Hagakure" by Yamamoto
> Tsunetomo
>
>
> --- kami_samurai_zojiro
> <kami_samurai_zojiro@...> wrote:
> > Hello BMcamp look for a book called "book of the
> > five rings" by
> > minamoto musashi also take a look at blackbelt
> > magizene you can find
> > a number to order themÂ  and a other book one called
> > "Idels of the
> > samurai"

I would check out "Musui's Story," even if it might be shocking for the
ones who like the idealized imagine of the brave, loyal, mighty
samurai.
cepo


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: good samurai books
messages.msgSnippet: Hello BMcamp look for a book called book of the five rings by minamoto musashi also take a look at blackbelt magizene you can find a number to order them
messages.messageBody:
Hello BMcamp look for a book called "book of the five rings" by
minamoto musashi also take a look at blackbelt magizene you can find
a number to order them and a other book one called "Idels of the
samurai"
